result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan A. Schaper

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CM64 and 15CM337 called together at 8:13am [mo]
Defendant Nathan A. Schaper in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance in both cases; provides Victim Impact Statement 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Counts #1 and #2 of Case 15CM337; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 15CM64
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Schaper

On Counts #1 and #2 of Case 15CM337, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--maintain absolute sobriety
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--random drug screening, at least one time per month
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--anger management counseling
--to provide DNA sample upon demand
--On Count #1: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #2: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  0 days
recess: 8:35

Cases 15CM64 and 15CM337 called together at 10:53am [mo]
Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant, Nathan Schaper does NOT appear.

Atty. Svehlek gives reasoning for Mr. Schaper's non-appearance; requests a Plea/ Sentencing date 
--No objection from ADA Hall

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 10:58am

NEXT: Plea/Sentencing on 1/21/16 at 8:10am

Cases 15CM337 and 15CM64 called together at 2:48pm [mo]
Defendant Nathan A. Schaper in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CM337(Initial Appearance occurs):
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $1500 signature bond, with conditions: 
--No presence at W1031 Hunter Lane in Ixonia
--No discussion of the facts of the case with Sondra or Laura Schaper
--No consumption of alcoholic beverages
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia



As to Case 15CM64(STC occurs):
--Atty. Svehlek requests that this case be scheduled with 15CM337
recess: 2:59pm
NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 11/18/15 at 2:20pm    (2)  Status Conference on 12/29/15 at 10:00am

Case called at 3:10pm [mo]
Defendant Nathan A. Schaper in court with attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Svehlek requests a PTC and STC to be scheduled.
The Court instructs the Clerk to schedule the dates and mail notice. 
recess: 3:14pm

NEXT: Schedule both DA PTC and STC and send notices to all parties

Case called at 3:17 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
Defendant Nathan A. Schaper not in court. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews change of address notification received on 7/17/15 - notice of hearing was sent to older address, which was sent prior to address & 
Court informs DA Happ that It will reschedule matter so notice can be sent to updated address
Victim Rights Compliance Verified
Recess: 3:20 pm 

N EXT: Reschedule STC 8/18/15 at 2:45 pm - Send notices

of Case Acceptance into the First Offender Program for 12 months
Status conference on April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Commissioner Fremgen presiding for Branch II
case called at 2:06pm. [MO]
Defendant Nathan A. Schaper appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Atty. Svehlek indicates Mr. Schaper is eligible for Public Defender appointment.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant


The Court requires a $500  signature bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--No discussion of the case with Laura Schaper OR Ryan Sondra
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possesiion of drug paraphenalia 

recess 2:12 pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference: 3/11/15 at 10:00am   (2) Status Conference: 4/14/15 at 8:30am
